title: Valley Of Torment
opening: In response to the Alliance Army's plea, Judith has agreed to provide soldiers. To meet up with reinforcements, the Alliance army sets out for Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Unbeknownst to Claude, something else awaits them there...
Your party travels to Ailell, the Valley of Torment, to meet up with allied troops and secure reinforcements. It should have been a safe march...

dialogue.speaker: Raphael
dialogue.line: What? Not enough left for seconds? I'm barely half full!

dialogue.speaker: Cyril
dialogue.line: Ya eat too much anyways, Raphael. Supplies are running low, so you're just gonna have to deal with it.

dialogue.speaker: Ignatz
dialogue.line: You've always been so level-headed, Cyril. Now that you've grown up, you're even more that way.

dialogue.speaker: Cyril
dialogue.line: Maybe it's just that the rest of you haven't grown enough. You could work harder at being reliable.

dialogue.speaker: Raphael
dialogue.line: I can't grow if I can't eat!

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: I have some good news for my hungry friends... We got a reply from Judith!

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: Mr. Leader Man has called a meeting about it. Hurry up, everyone!

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: We finally received a reply from Judith. The Hero of Daphnel has agreed to support us with soldiers and supplies.

dialogue.speaker: Raphael
dialogue.line: She's gonna give us food? She really is a hero!

dialogue.speaker: Cyril
dialogue.line: Maybe Raphael will simmer down now.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Now, regarding where we're going to receive the delivery...

dialogue.speaker: Judith
dialogue.line: As this is a request from none other than the leader of the Alliance, I wish that I could send troops at once. However... Openly marshaling soldiers within my territory could provoke other members of the Alliance. Therefore, I will secretly gather troops in Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Will your group be able to receive the soldiers at this location? From there, it should be safe to return to the monastery by following the border between the Alliance and the Kingdom.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Ailell is on the border between the Daphnel territory and the Kingdom. It'll make sense when we get there, but it's a peculiar region.

dialogue.speaker: Marianne
dialogue.line: I recall there being a scary legend about it...

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: In any case, if we use that valley, we shouldn't have to worry about being noticed by other Alliance lords.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: You know… I'd never have been recognized as the legitimate heir to House Riegan without Judith's recommendation… Feels like I'm digging myself deeper and deeper in debt to the Hero of Daphnel, but what do you do? It's all been worth it. After all, we need the Daphnel army for our next move. It's possible we'll have to deal with our enemy sooner than later. Be prepared, Teach.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: The bridge that links Alliance and Empire lands is currently under the occupation of the Imperial army. In other words, the Empire can choose to invade the Alliance whenever they wish. I want you to understand that my father does not support the Empire to antagonize House Riegan. He does it to deprive them of an easy excuse to cross that bridge.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Sharing her food with us for nothing in return? Judith really is a great person! She's more like a goddess than the goddess is!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: She is very much like a goddess.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I never met her, so I don't know for sure, but she must be beautiful and kind.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm not sure about that.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: No? Well, she could be a demon for all I care, so long as she feeds me!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: The Valley of Torment... I'd heard of it, but I never expected to go there. It's exciting! I wonder what the landscape is like.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It sounds dangerous.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: It probably is dangerous, but I still want to get there and see it as soon as I can.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It sounds painful.

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: Hm, that is an interesting point... The name does seem to suggest that.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Ailell, the Valley of Torment, lies on the border of three noble territories. The Kingdom's Fraldarius and Galatea families, and the Alliance's Daphnel family. In the Fraldarius lands to the north, the former Kingdom army and new duke's army are fighting.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Valley of Torment... Valley of Torment...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Something wrong?

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I once read a book full of legends surrounding Ailell, but I can't seem to remember...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Are you chanting some sort of curse?

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: N-no... I'm trying to remember the legends surrounding Ailell...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: My big brother told me stories of Judith's bravery. With just one look, she tamed a runaway horse that nobody else had been able to touch. When an Almyran general provoked her, she talked him into a tearful apology. She's spectacular. I wish she'd fight alongside us.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: You're not a teacher anymore, and we're not your students, but everyone still calls you Professor. Is there something you'd rather be called?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Professor is fine.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Guess that's what we're used to, huh? All right.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Call me by my name.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Oh? All right, then. I'll call you - ugh. Nope! Sorry, can't do it. Too weird.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Some day we will take the Imperial capital. It is odd to think that I will be invading the very city that I once called home. Ah, that is still a ways off. I will prepare for our journey to Ailell.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I never do get used to the sight of blood. It always makes me feel as if I might faint. Have I never told you that? Huh. Oh well. I hope this war ends soon. I dislike being lightheaded because other people are bleeding everywhere. Though the thought of working hard for it does sound like quite a pain...

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I didn't think we'd end up fighting Randolph... He's my uncle. Well, not by blood, so... I guess I can handle it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm still worried about you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're very resolute.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Don't worry about me. I'm ready for anything.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Ailell, the Valley of Torment? What kind of a name for a place is that? It sounds scary. Do I really have to go with you? Hey, um, here's an idea... Maybe let the recluse stay home and hold the fort!

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Hey, Professor, thanks for your hard work again! Nothing to report today! Was I convincing? Was it like he was standing right in front of you? Some things are the same as they were five years ago, but I guess a lot more has changed...

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Since the past, I have learned much of the language of Fódlan. But speaking the Fódlan language still gives me difficulty. I can understand, read, and write with nearly perfection now. But understanding and speaking are...fruits of a different color.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's part of your charm

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I have gratitude for you, Professor. I hope that I will have fluency one day.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Everyone has a weak spot.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Yes. I will keep practicing more.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Some in Faerghus believe Dimitri is still alive. My father is one such eccentric. Hmph, they can't accept reality. Dimitri is dead. He's not coming back.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Ailell, the Valley of Torment. Aw, man... I really do not want to go there.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Pull yourself together.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Professor, have you ever been to Ailell? If you had, you'd know.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Why not?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: That place is crazy hot! For guys like me who grew up somewhere cold? Man... It's gonna be rough. Though, I guess that climate will keep our enemies at bay.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: We may not be students anymore, but it's still important to read. We might even learn something that's useful for our next battle.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Studying is important.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I couldn't agree more! I hope the Officers Academy reopens when the war is over.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Training is important too.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I suppose that may be true. I always try my best at both.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: It's a shame the monastery was ruined but...At least the books are still intact!

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Professor, how do Claude and Judith know each other? I hear there are still quarrels within the Alliance… This generous offer of soldiers and supplies seems a little too good to be true. I mean, it’s also really impressive, but I’m just a little worried, I suppose…

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: My family, the Galateas, are an offshoot of the Daphnel family. The family split in half when two brothers quarreled over an inheritance. Despite blood relations, the families lived apart from one another, so the relationship has been distant and somewhat estranged. I’m not so much acquainted with Judith, the head of House Daphnel.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Meeting reinforcements in the Valley of Torment seems an astute decision to me. In that land of oppressive heat, it is unlikely that we will be disturbed. It also means we will need to contend with those harsh conditions ourselves, however. Best ensure we are well prepared.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: It has been only five years, yet so much has changed. Half of the Kingdom has fallen to the Empire. Skirmishes are rife throughout the Alliance. Despite such tumult, we look upon the same sky, unchanged by the storm happening beneath it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you wish you could return to those days?

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Yes, it would be nice, I suppose. Things were... simpler then. Or so they seemed to be, at the time.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's true - it's just like it was all those years ago.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Indeed. I gazed up at the same sky with Mother and Father. It does not feel so long ago at all. Wait, but how would you know, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: The monastery repairs have made solid progress. Most excellent news. When we first returned here, I was unsure what we were going to do with the ruins of this place... But if we can get the cathedral rebuilt, we'll have it looking just like the old times soon enough.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Hearing that an old student has died cuts me right to the heart... As this war with the Empire continues, we'll see more of it, Professor. We have a duty to fight alongside our former students. We taught them how to fight, after all. Now, let's help them win!

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Even though we're getting reinforcements, we should still be prepared for the worst. Never shirk your training, no matter what. To practice, I'm going to chop something up with my sword. Unless you'd like to train together! Care to spar?

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: I've heard people talk about the Hero of Daphnel. If the stories of her courage are true, no one will be able to stand against us. In different circumstances, I'd have wanted to try crossing swords with her. Right now we have to focus on getting to those reinforcements. Let's hope nothing goes wrong.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: There are enemy spies around. Remain vigilant. Capture anyone who seems suspicious.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: To kill them?

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: What else would we do with them?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: All right, I will.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: I'm glad you understand. I'm counting on you.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Gotta clean out the storerooms, tend the flowers, do the washing, dust the library...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That sounds like a lot of work.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Well, it's my job, ya know? Gotta do your job.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Do you need any help?

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Nah, this is my job. Lady Rhea herself gave it do me.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Even if Lady Rhea's not here right now, I still gotta do my duty.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Like you. You gotta have other stuff you oughta be doing, yeah?

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Is everyone setting out on a big campaign? Not exactly? Ah, so you're meeting up with the reinforcements. We'll, you can leave guarding this place to me! I'll keep an eye out for anything suspicious!

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Ugh, why is it so hot? I'm getting all sweaty!

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Don't be a wimp! Anything's worth it for more food supplies.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: Move over, Raphael. Somehow you make the heat even worse.

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Let's stay calm, everyone. Once we meet up with Judith's soldiers, we can go right back home.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Oh, I finally remembered! The legend goes that this valley was born from the wrath of the goddess...

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: They say a pillar of light poured from the heavens and completely burned away the forest that used to be here...

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: So you're telling me the goddess, who is supposed to be benevolent, burned a forest to a crisp? Typical.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: That's what the legend would have us believe. But it's not recorded in any of the scriptures...

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Either it's completely made up, or the goddess is some kind of monster.

intro.speaker: Cyril
intro.line: Huh? Is that...

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: The time for idle chatter is over, Claude. Look over there.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Ah, has someone come to greet us?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Enemies?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Allies?

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: That banner does not bear the Daphnel Crest.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: If memory serves... That's the Crest of House Rowe, formerly lords of the Kingdom. They joined the Empire's side without hesitation during the coup. And now here they are, lying in wait for us.

intro.speaker: Shamir
intro.line: Damn... I thought we had disposed of all the spies...

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: House Rowe is mediocre and vulgar, but I hear their knights are powerful.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: What about the Daphnel soldiers? You don't think...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'm worried about Judith.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Judith will be fine. It would take a lot more than that to take her down.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We need to break through their ranks.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: We've already been spotted, so there's no time to come up with a brilliant plan.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Everyone, prepare for battle! I leave the command in your capable hands, my friend.

battle.speaker: Gwendal
battle.line: The Valley of Torment... Perhaps a good place to finish off my life as a knight. Only if that puny force of children is able to kill me, of course...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: So, their general must be that stubborn-looking old man. He looks like he wouldn't even forgive a sobbing child. It's good we came armed for the occasion. Care to find Judith?

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Flames are flaring everywhere and burning people where they stand... Ailell is a terrible place. Everyone, if you don't want to get burned to a crisp, watch your step!

battle.speaker: Gwendal
battle.line: The Crest of Flames? Ha! Quite full of themselves, aren't they?

battle.speaker: Ashe
battle.line: Just as I thought - the professor's army. But it's too late to back out now. In Lonato's place, I have to do my duty.

battle.speaker: Judith
battle.line: Oh, old Gwendal is here. And he doesn't look to be an ally...

battle.speaker: Gwendal
battle.line: Oh, the Hero of Daphnel is here! I'll expect more from her than the young ones...

battle.speaker: Defeat Conditions
battle.line: All of your units fall in battle, or Judith is defeated.

battle.speaker: Kingdom Soldier
battle.line: Here we go! Attack them from both sides!

battle-talk.speaker: Judith
battle-talk.line: So, you're finally here, supreme leader. And something extra has tagged along.

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Sorry, Judith. That rat got away.

battle-talk.speaker: Judith
battle-talk.line: Hey, don't worry. And here, you should have this. Perhaps it will come in handy.

boss.speaker: Gwendal
boss.line: Does a whelp like you really expect to kill me? I am Gwendal, the Gray Lion, a knight by the hand of Count Rowe! Do your worst!

boss.speaker: Gwendal
boss.line: Ah, so I have found a place to die... Young ones... I thank you...

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: That old man must have been struggling with the position he found himself in... It's time to gather ourselves and pull back our troops.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: To think we'd get into a scrap here of all places. We're lucky we all made it out alive.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm sorry for involving you in this.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Don't worry about it. In this day and age, it's a miracle I've been unscathed this long.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I can see why they call you a hero.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Well, that's ancient history.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Anyway, long time no see, Professor! Are you still watching this boy's back?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Can you quit calling me a boy in front of everyone? I'm the leader of the Alliance now. It's not proper-

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Not proper, is it? Says the leader who has neglected Alliance territory for years. If you're really the Master Tactician, you should go back to working quietly at whatever little desk you do your planning on.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Ugh, don't call me that either. Who even came up with that nickname?

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: It's a perfect title for a boy who loves crafty schemes as much as you do. You should be grateful to the professor. On your own, you'd look like a scoundrel of a leader.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Haha! Claude's usually so flippant, but even he gets overwhelmed when Judith is around!

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: As expected from the leader of the prestigious House Daphnel. Her dignity if beyond compare, even if she is no longer one of the Five Great Lords.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The Five Great Lords?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: The prestigious House Daphnel?

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: The five most influential lords of the Leicester Alliance. They hold the voting rights at the roundtable conferences. House Daphnel used to be included among their ranks, but division from within has hastened their decline. Their vote has since been passed to the emerging Margrave Edmund.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Thanks for the exposition, Gloucester boy.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: Boy?! I will not-

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Now to business. There were some unexpected interruptions, but I've brought soldiers and supplies, as promised.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Thanks, Judith. I'll gladly take them off your hands...

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Hold your horses, boy. You're misunderstanding. These soldiers are precious to me. I made them what they are. I'm not about to loan them out to someone.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: No? Then why did you come here?!

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: What I'm saying is that I'll be joining your army. You're going to fight the Empire with the Knights of Seiros, right? Fight for Lady Rhea? Not without me.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: That's admirable and all, but we still don't know for sure if Rhea is in the-

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Oh, she's there. A witness saw Lady Rhea being dragged off by the Imperial army after the battle five years ago.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: Are you sure your source is reliable?!

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: One of my own saw it happen. I'm certain.

end.speaker: Alois
end.line: It seems we chose wisely when we decided to fight against the Empire.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: But you're the leader of House Daphnel. Is it OK for you to leave your territory unattended?

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: And what about you? Is it OK for you to leave the Riegan territory unattended?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: That's... I've left it in the hands of a reliable retainer and-

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: And I've asked that retainer to watch over Daphnel territory as well.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Wait, wait, wait... You just up and decided to get my retainer to do that without even asking me? No respect, this one...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What retainer?

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Oh? You haven't met him yet, Professor? His name is Nardel. He strikes me as a really special individual. And he's quite handsome too!

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: So that's your definition of handsome?

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: No objections, then? Good. That settles it. House Daphnel is now yours to command.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I'm sure you'd come along even if I refused. So be it. We'll be counting on you, Judith.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: With Judith joining our forces, we've secured some more troops and supplies... albeit not many.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: Hmph. I'm sorry it couldn't be more.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: No, it's enough for the time being. We'll use them to secure even more troops and supplies.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: How so?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: You think we can do that?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: The key to my plan is Count Gloucester, the leader of the pro-Empire faction in the Alliance.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: You intend to sway my father to join the other side?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: If Count Gloucester were to switch to the other side, that would basically unify the Alliance. Then we could utilize our full military force in the fight against the Empire.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: You don't mean to ask me to persuade him, do you? That would be... quite impossible.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I don't plan on it. We'll just take his concerns out of the equation. The Airmid River flows along the border between Gloucester territory and the Empire, right? Of all the bridges that cross it, the Great Bridge of Myrddin is the only one near Gloucester territory large enough for an army. Currently, the Imperial army occupies it.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: So, if we were to capture the bridge...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Count Gloucester would be freed from the threat of the Empire. Thanks to us.

end.speaker: Lysithea
end.line: But we have to pass through Gloucester territory to reach the Great Bridge of Myrddin, do we not?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Yes. And if we attempted it, naturally he would try to stop us.

end.speaker: Lorenz
end.line: I am sorry, but I must ask. Surely you do not plan to engage in combat with my father?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Don't worry. I want him as a future ally. What good would it do to waste both of our forces fighting?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I take it you have a scheme?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Who do you think you're taking to, Teach? Preparations are in the works even now.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: So, we'll be sneaking through?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: We can't be stealthy with so many people. But I have a scheme. Preparations are already in the works.

end.speaker: Judith
end.line: So the Master Tactician is finally going to show us his true power. I'm looking forward to it!

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I'll do my best to live up to that name by making my scheme as impressive as possible.
